001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor;
002
003import android.graphics.Color;
004import androidx.annotation.ColorInt;
005
006public interface IColorSensor {
007    /** Get the RGB red of the sensor
008     *
009     * @return Red
010     */
011    default int red() {
012        return (argb() >> 16) & 0xff;
013    }
014
015    /** Get the RGB green of the sensor
016     *
017     * @return Green
018     */
019    default int green() {
020        return (argb() >> 8) & 0xff;
021    }
022
023    /** Get the RGB blue of the sensor
024     *
025     * @return Blue
026     */
027    default int blue() {
028        return (argb()) & 0xff;
029    }
030
031    /** Get the alpha (transparency) of the color
032     *
033     * @return Alpha
034     */
035    default int alpha() {
036        return (argb() >> 24) & 0xff;
037    }
038
039    /** Get HSV as an int
040     *
041     * @return HSV
042     */
043    default int hsv() {
044        float[] f = this.hsvArray();
045        return ((int) f[0] << 16) | ((int) f[1] << 8) | (int) f[2];
046    }
047
048    default int rgb() {
049        return (argb()) & 0x00ffffff;
050    }
051
052    @ColorInt
053    int argb();
054
055    default float[] hsvArray() {
056        float[] f = new float[3];
057
058        Color.RGBToHSV(red(), green(), blue(), f);
059        return f;
060    }
061
062    /** Get HSV hue
063     *
064     * @return Hue
065     */
066    default int hue() {
067        return (int) this.hsvArray()[0];
068    }
069
070    /** Get HSV saturation
071     *
072     * @return Saturation
073     */
074    default int saturation() {
075        return (int) this.hsvArray()[1];
076    }
077
078    /** Get HSV value (not entire HSV, just 'V')
079     *
080     * @return Value
081     */
082    default int value() {
083        return (int) this.hsvArray()[2];
084    }
085}
